summary: REQ-9, REQ-12 appear implemented via a new Contact section (with correct mailto/wa.me links) and updated footer contact links, plus header navigation includes a Contact item with smooth scroll. REQ-10 appears implemented in the footer by removing caffeine.ai attribution (no such text shown in the modified footer). REQ-11 adds new credibility sections (services breakdown, process timeline, social proof, FAQ), but the Social Proof content includes potentially unverifiable performance-like claims and concrete numerical stats, which conflicts with the requirement to avoid unverifiable claims/numbers unless provided by the user.

missing_requirements.requirement: Added content does not include unverifiable claims (no real client logos, brand names, or performance numbers unless provided by the user).
missing_requirements.reason: The new Social Proof section includes specific large numeric stats (e.g., 500+/200+/1000+) and testimonial language implying results/ROI, which are performance-number-like claims not provided by the user (even if labeled illustrative).

hallucinated_features.description: Contact section includes additional non-requested detail cards (Response Time and Working Hours).
hallucinated_features.reason: REQ-9 only requests a Contact section with email and WhatsApp details reachable from navigation; response time/working hours are extra content not explicitly requested.
